alert.note: Alert for Pacific (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Portland (Northwest Oregon and Southwest Washington)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 06 at 3:29PM PST until further notice by NWS Portland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 315 AM PST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Small stream and low lying areal flooding caused by excessive rainfall and snowmelt is occurring at levels not observed in over a decade. * WHERE...Clatsop and far northwestern Columbia County in northwest Oregon and Pacific and western portions of Wahkiakum County in southwest Washington. * WHEN...Until 315 AM PST Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 323 PM PST, Emergency management, the public and law enforcement have reported flooding in the warned area. Between 3 and 6 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Astoria, Seaside, Warrenton, Cannon Beach, Long Beach, Cathlamet, Grays River, Frances, Jewell, Ocean Park, Raymond, Clatskanie, South Bend, Ilwaco, Rosburg, Knappa, Naselle, Skamokawa, Lebam and Hammond Town. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
